column1: Nagod or Nagaud is a town and a nagar panchayat in Satna district in the Indian state of Madhya Pradesh. It is located 17 miles (27 km) from the town of Satna. It is the administrative headquarters of Nagod Tehsil.It is believed that it was a small state owned by an oil-pressing people
column3: who were exiled by the Pratiharas. Pratiharas originally came from Kannauj and belong to Agnikula Rajput.

column1: Nagod derives its name from Nagdev meaning town or city.
Nagod is located at 24.57°N 80.6°E﻿ / 24.57; 80.6. It has an average elevation of 330 metres (1
column2: 082 feet). Nagod is near to the district headquarters at Satna and is well-connected by roads. The Amarna river flows near the town's fort.

column1: Nagod was formerly the capital of a princely state of British India
column2: Nagod State. The state was founded in 1344
column3: and until the 18th century was known as Unchahara from the name of its original capital.
568. Males constitute 53% of the population and females 47%. Nagod has an average literacy rate of 68%
column4: higher than the national average of 59.5%: male literacy is 76%
column5: and female literacy is 60%. In Nagod
column6: 16% of the population is under 6 years of age.
